questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: When 8.74 g MnO₂ is treated with HCl then what will be the weight of Cl₂(g), obtained : [Molar mass of MnO₂ = 87.4 g/mol]

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Calculate Bond Energy of C – H bond in CH₄. Given : ΔHf of CH₄(g) = – x kJ/mol, ΔHsub of carbon = y kJ/mol, B.E. of H – H = z kJ/mol.

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Following transition are made by an electron in a hydrogen like species. Find energy order of emitted photon: (A) 1st line of Lyman Series (B) 2nd line of Balmer Series (C) 3rd line of Paschen Series (D) 4th line of Brackett Series

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: For a Daniel cell, select correct variation of E°cell with time

options.text: Graph showing decreasing E°cell with time
Graph showing constant E°cell with time
Graph showing increasing E°cell with time
Graph showing oscillating E°cell with time

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: A(g) → B(g) + C(g). Initial pressure of A is 1 bar after 100 min. total pressure becomes 1.5 bar. Find value of rate constant of the reaction assuming first order reaction.

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Statement-I : The correct order for radius is Al > Mg > Mg²⁺ > Al³⁺. Statement-II : Atomic size always depends on electronegativity.

options.text: Both statements I and II are correct.
Both statements I and II are false.
Statement I is correct and II is false.
Statement I is false and II is correct.

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Statement-I : Bond dissociation energy order is : Cl₂ > Br₂ > F₂ > I₂. Statement-II : Bond dissociation energy is independent of bond order

options.text: Both statements I and II are correct.
Both statements I and II are false.
Statement I is correct and II is false.
Statement I is false and II is correct.

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: NaCl(solid) + H₂SO₄(conc.) + K₂Cr₂O₇(s) → Product

options.text: Product is CrO₂Cl₂ and oxidation state of Cr = +6
Product is Cr₂O₂Cl₂ and oxidation state of Cr = +6
Product is Cr₂O₂Cl₂ and oxidation state of Cr = +3
Product is CrO₂Cl₂ and oxidation state of Cr = +3

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Which of following is correct order of bond length?

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Statement-I : The correct order of electron affinity is Cl > Br > S > O. Statement-II : Correct order of ionic character is PbCl₂ < PbCl₄ , UF₆ < UF₄ , SnCl₄ > SnCl₂

options.text: Statement I is correct and statement II is incorrect.
Both statement I and II are correct.
Statement I is incorrect and statement II is correct.
Both statement I and II are incorrect.

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Statement-I : Among [Mn(H₂O)₆]²⁺ and [Cr(H₂O)₆]²⁺ , the more stable complex is [Mn(H₂O)₆]²⁺. Statement-II : Magnetic moment of K₃[Fe(CN)₆] > K₄[Fe(CN)₆].

options.text: Statements I and II both are correct.
Statement I is correct and Statement II is incorrect.
Statement I is incorrect and statement II is correct.
Both statements I and II are incorrect.

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Rate of reaction of nucleophilic substitution with KCN in polar protic solvent for compounds (A) CH₂–Br with OH substituent (B) CH₂–Br with NH₂ substituent (C) CH₂–Br with NO₂ substituent (D) CH₂–Br with NO₂ substituent

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Match correctly from the reagents given in Column-I with the named reaction given in Column-II. (P) Pd-BaSO₄ (Q) CrO₂Cl₂ + CS₂ (R) SnCl₂+HCl (S) CO + HCl + AlCl₃ anhydrous with (1) Etard reaction (2) Stephen's reduction (3) Gattermann's Koch reaction (4) Rosenmund's reduction

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Match the list-I with list-II (P) Cis-2-Butene, trans-2-butene (Q) Diethyl ether, Butanol (R) 1-Butene, 2-Butene (S) n-Pentane, Isopentane with (1) Functional isomers (2) Stereoisomers (3) Position isomers (4) Chain isomers

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Which of the following statement is/are correct? (a) Nucleotide containing 1,4-linkage. (b) Quaternary structure of protein is compact folded structure. (c) During denaturation of protein secondary and tertiary structure destroyed and primary structure retained. (d) Enthalpy of enzymatic hydrolysis of sucrose is greater than acid catalysed hydrolysis of sucrose.

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Find correct order of rate of reaction of CH₃Br with given nucleophiles: OH⁻, PhO⁻, HCOO⁻, ClO₄⁻

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Statement-1: There is 2sp³, 1 sp² and 1 sp hybridised carbon present in CH = C = O. Statement-2: The given compound has two chiral centres.

options.text: Statement-1 is incorrect but Statement-2 is correct
Statement-1 is correct but Statement-2 is incorrect

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: 1 gm of unknown organic compound produce 1.49 of Mg₂P₂O₇ determine % of P in unknown organic compound:

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Calculate E°(Cl⁻/AgCl/Ag) (in millivolt) Given: E°(Ag⁺/Ag) = 0.79 V, Ksp(AgCl) = 10⁻¹⁰, (2.303 RT)/F = 0.059.

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: In following 4 molecules one is optically active and find the % of carbon in chiral compound: 1-Chlorobutane, 2-Chloropropane, 2-Chlorobutane, 1-Chloro-2, 2-Dimethyl propane

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: For a living cell, osmotic pressure is 12 atm at 300 K, which is isotonic with NaCl(aq.) solution then strength of NaCl solution is _____ × 10⁻² g/L. [R = 0.08 L-atm/mol-K]

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Find concentration of X²⁻ at equilibrium in 0.1 M H₂X ? (in order of 10⁻¹⁵) Given : Ka₁ = 2.5 × 10⁻⁸, Ka₂ = 1 × 10⁻¹³.

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Elevation of Boiling point of a solution containing 15 gm solute in 150 gm solvent is 0.5°C, and relative lowering in vapour pressure is x × 10⁻² then find x (Assume dilute solution) Given molar mass of solvent = 300 gm/mole, Kb = 5 K-kg/mole

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Among the following V³⁺, Ti²⁺, Ni²⁺, Fe²⁺, Co²⁺ for which spin only magnetic moment > 3, and which can form high spin octahedral complex. Find the sum of unpaired electrons in those complexes.
questions.concept: Magnetic moments and crystal field theory

questions.subject: CHEMISTRY
questions.questionText: Starting from nitrobenzene, after the given sequence of reactions: (1) Br₂/Fe (2) Sn/HCl (3) pH neutral solution (4) Br₂/H₂O (5) NaNO₂ HCl (6) CuBr, find the number of bromine atoms in major product?
